Yes if you store your worms in a 10-litre container or larger with peat moss and loose organic material you can keep them alive and breeding for months. Please keep their bedding moist.Did this answer your question? $Yes,No

The following are generalised, frequently asked questions$Why is your product different from
 your competitors?,Is your product organically certified?,What is the shelf life of the product?,How do I store the product?,The VermiGold tonic has no smell is
 that normal?,Don’t see your question?
We extract our liquid straight from the worm beds and in containers for sale. We do not ferment the product nor add other matter. Did this answer your question?$Yes,No
Yes, our VermiGold tonic is organically certified by NASAA, our certification number is NCO 5562 M. Please refer to our website for further details
VermiGold tonic has an indefinite shelf life but for commercial purposes, we have set a limit of 2 years.
Store VermiGold out of the sun preferable in temperatures below 30 degrees.
If there is a smell coming from the liquid, it often means that the bacteria have died. Therefore, the liquid should have no or a little odour only. Did this answer your question?$Yes,No

What sort of question do you have?$Can I buy more or less than 1 kilo
 of compost worms?,Don’t see your question?

We restrict a maximum of 1 Kilo of worms so that we can make limited supplies to as many buyers as possible. We dont sell less than 1 Kilo (approx 4000 worms) as handling and shipment cost will not make this economical.

 Fish Worms?,Don’t see your question?
Yes, but will perform slightly better in fresh water. Did this answer your question?$Yes,No
There is no limit but is subject to availability. Did this answer your question?$Yes,No

What sort of question do you have?$When are pellets available?,Don’t see your question?

We use our castings to set up new worm beds as our tonic is in high demand. The excess castings we pellet twice a year, please contact us for when this is available again. Did this answer your question?$Yes,No
